intro: Lycianthes pauciflora subsp. tobagoensis, commonly known as the Tobago nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, tomatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and oval-shaped, hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas in tropical and subtropical regions. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that turns red when mature.
